Package calculator

Class CalculatorAdvanced

java.lang.Object
calculator.Calculator
calculator.CalculatorAdvanced
public class CalculatorAdvanced extends Calculator
Class Calculator serves the purpose of performing a more complex set of operations which includes factorials, exponents and checking if a number is perfect or Armstrong.
Since:
4.12.2023
Version:
1.0
Author:
Mihajlo Pasic

  • Method Details

    • calculateAdvanced

      public void calculateAdvanced(char action) throws NotSupportedOperationException, NumberNotInAreaException
      Method calculateAdvanced performs different operations based on the input character. If the input character is '!' then factorial operation will be performed on the currentValue in the calculator. If the input character is a number between '0' and '9' then the exponentiation function will be performed.
      Parameters:
      action - input character.
      Throws:
      NotSupportedOperationException - is thrown when a unsupported operator is provided as an argument.
      NumberNotInAreaException - is thrown when the current value in calculator is less or equal to 0.

    • hasCharacteristic

      public Boolean hasCharacteristic(char value) throws NotSupportedOperationException, NumberNotInAreaException
      Method hasCharacterisic performs different checking operations based on the input character. If the input character is 'A' then the function checks if the currentValue in calculator is an Armstrong number. If the input character is 'P' then the function checks if the currentValue in calculator is a perfect number.
      Parameters:
      value - input character.
      Returns:
      the check result.
      Throws:
      NotSupportedOperationException - is thrown when a unsupported operator is provided as an argument.
      NumberNotInAreaException - is thrown when the current value in calculator is less or equal to 0.
